messages: 57fbfc6a11e6f008652106f2a04b6ee3 (09:45): I just installed FCE Ultra
57fbfc6a11e6f008652106f2a04b6ee3 (09:45): and when I try to run it, I get an error that  libvga.so.1 is missing
57fbfc6a11e6f008652106f2a04b6ee3 (09:45): where do I obtain that?
e07300d6d014ea5d4ac4192c9ed6bcc3 (09:47): */usr/share/doc/packages/SDL-devel/html/sdlenvvars.html  this is all I could find sorry
c080324e0c5a5e4729fbb9e29105b096 (09:57): When i did a search in yast it says aalib provides libvga.so.1
c080324e0c5a5e4729fbb9e29105b096 (09:57): so maybe you can try installing aalib from your suse CDs
e07300d6d014ea5d4ac4192c9ed6bcc3 (10:03): cant find a thing even on forums :(
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:05): morning
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:09): i am confused over smart and YOU
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:09): whats up?
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:10): ok, so suse 10.1 comes default with Firefox 1.5.0.3
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:11): and then we use YOU to update.
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:11): it will actually upgrade it to 1.5.0.4
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:11): not sure
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:11): so now I am using SMART.
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:11): the full
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:12): because it's 7mb
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:12): smart does not handles .patch.rpm
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:12): but it fetches the full rpm.
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:12): so in effect SMART does upgrade also.
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:12): yer, because it has the SUSE update repos
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:13): they are slow to bring out 1.5.0.5
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:13): looking at the SUSE update repos, there's 3 types of rpm,
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:13): patch rpm, delta rpm and full rpm
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:13): indeed
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:13): so SMART only cares about the full rpms
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:13): patchrpms contain only changed files, deltarpms are binary diffs against original package
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:14): benJIman: when we does update via YOU, whcih rpms does it use?
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:14): ykphuah: in 9.2-10.0 deltarpms
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:14): ykphuah: in 10.1 deltarpm support is broken
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:14): but it should be back for 10.2 I hope
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:15): how bout the patch.rpm?
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:15): they were used before deltas
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:15): so patch rpm is obsolete?
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:15): pretty much,they're significantly bigger
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:15): replaced by delta rpms?
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:16): you can stop YOU from using deltas by adjusting /etc/sysconfig/onlineupdate YOU_USE_DELTAS
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:17): Yet Another Service Broken :p
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:17): yeah 10.1 is back to the dark ages
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:17): so, as the suse update repos provide the full rpms as well, i can use SMART to do the same upgrade that YOU would do.
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:18): so what's the deal with the suse-mozilla repos?
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:18): issit like a /testing?
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:18): Ancient1, yo
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:19): ykphuah provides latest mozilla builds from whoever maintains it, why?
46b1b66a863392c9bdd527d78563c970 (10:19): SuseUX: say , do u know of a way to run gnome new menu in kde ?
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:19): Ancient1: you can install the rpms
80891c186adad4126f80178d694880f6 (10:19): benJIman: why is there a separate repos and the latest are not in the suse default update repos?
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:19): Ancient1, use gnome panel in KDE? :p
46b1b66a863392c9bdd527d78563c970 (10:19): benJIman: morning :)  I did
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:20): ykphuah: YOU updates only have security updates normally
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:20): ykphuah: suse generally backport security fixes to the version shipped with the distro

4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:20): the only reason usually new versions of mozilla stuff are shipped instead is that they make doing that very difficult, as they mix the fixes, and don't inform distributors of changes
21b47857d1e6fda6dbeb0ea55161637f (10:21): then why has ubuntu got 1.5.0.5 as a security update so quick?
4a0538f0d35eaec6f6aa84da6641e578 (10:21): there is much QA testing updates have to pass for a start
